An optional exception.
Optional format parameters for the message generated by the messagefunc.
member.returns: true if the message was logged. Otherwise false.
member.remarks:
Note to implementers: the message func should not be called if the loglevel is not enabled so as not to incur performance penalties.
To check IsEnabled call Log with only LogLevel and check the return value, no event will be written.

member.name: M:Nexmo.Api.Logging.LogProviders.LogMessageFormatter.SimulateStructuredLogging(System.Func{System.String},System.Object[])
member.summary:
Some logging frameworks support structured logging, such as serilog. This will allow you to add names to structured data in a format string: For example: Log("Log message to {user}", user). This only works with serilog, but as the user of LibLog, you don't know if serilog is actually used. So, this class simulates that. it will replace any text in {curly braces} with an index number.
"Log {message} to {user}" would turn into => "Log {0} to {1}". Then the format parameters are handled using regular .net string.Format.
member.param: The message builder.
The format parameters.

member.summary: An 11 character alphanumeric string to specify the SenderID for SMS sent by Verify. Depending on the destination of the phone number you are applying, restrictions may apply. By default, sender_id is VERIFY.

member.summary: The length of the PIN. Possible values are 6 or 4 characters. The default value is 4.

member.summary: By default, the SMS or text-to-speech (TTS) message is generated in the locale that matches the number. For example, the text message or TTS message for a 33* number is sent in French. Use this parameter to explicitly control the language, accent and gender used for the Verify request. The default language is en-us.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.require_type
member.summary:
Restrict verification to a certain network type. Possible values are: All (Default) Mobile Landline
Note: contact support@nexmo.com to enable this feature.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.pin_expiry
member.summary: The PIN validity time from generation. This is an integer value between 60 and 3600 seconds. The default is 300 seconds. When specified together, pin_expiry must be an integer multiple of next_event_wait. Otherwise, pin_expiry is set to equal next_event_wait. For example: pin_expiry = 360 seconds, so next_event_wait = 120 seconds - all three attempts have the same PIN. pin_expiry = 240 seconds, so next_event_wait = 120 seconds - 1st and 2nd attempts have the same PIN, third attempt has a different PIN. pin_expiry = 120 (or 200 or 400 seconds) - each attempt has a different PIN.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.next_event_wait
member.summary: An integer value between 60 and 900 seconds inclusive that specifies the wait time between attempts to deliver the PIN. Verify calculates the default value based on the average time taken by users to complete verification.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.NumberVerify.VerifyRequest.workflow_id
member.summary: The workflow ID for selecting verification workflow - choose between 1 and 5 full guide https://developer.nexmo.com/verify/guides/workflows-and-events workflow_id = 1, (Default Workflow): SMS -> TTS -> TTS workflow_id = 2, SMS -> SMS -> TTS workflow_id = 3, TTS -> TTS workflow_id = 4, SMS -> SMS workflow_id = 5, SMS -> TTS

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.from
member.summary: An alphanumeric string giving your sender address. For example, from=MyCompany20. See our information Global messaging. This is also called the SenderID.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.to
member.summary: A single phone number in international format, that is E.164 . For example, to=447700900000. You can set one recipient only for each request.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.type
member.summary: Default value is text. Possible values are: text - for plain text SMS, you must also set the text parameter. binary - for binary SMS you must also set the udh and body parameters. Do not set the text parameter. wappush - a WAP Push . You must also set the title and url parameters. Do not set the text or body parameters. unicode - SMS in unicode contain fewer characters than text. Only use unicode when your SMS must contain special characters. For more information, see Encoding. vcal - send a calendar event. You send your vCal encoded calendar event in the vcal parameter. vcard - send a business card. You send your vCard encoded business card in the the vcard parameter.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.text
member.summary: The SMS body. Messages where type is text (the default) are in UTF-8 with URL encoding. You send "Déjà vu" as a text (type=text) message as long as you encode it as D%C3%A9j%C3%A0+vu. You can see the full UTF-8 character set here . To test if your message can be URL encoded, use: http://www.url-encode-decode.com/ . If you cannot find the character you want to send in these two references, you should use unicode. For more information, see Encoding.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.status_report_req
member.summary: Set to 1 to receive a Delivery Receipt (DLR). To receive the DLR, you have to either: Configure a webhook endpoint in Dashboard. Set the callback parameter.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.vcard
member.summary: A business card in vCard. You must set the type parameter to vcard.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.vcal
member.summary: A calendar event in vCal. You must set the type parameter to vcal.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.ttl
member.summary: The lifespan of this SMS in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.callback
member.summary: The webhook endpoint the delivery receipt for this sms is sent to. This parameter overrides the webhook endpoint you set in Dashboard. This must be a fully formed URL. For example: https://mysite.com/sms_api_callback.php.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.message_class
member.summary: Set to: 0 for Flash SMS, 1 - ME-specific, 2 - SIM / USIM specific, 3 - TE-specific See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Data_Coding_Scheme Note: Flash SMS is not fully support by all handsets and carriers.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.udh
member.summary: Your custom Hex encoded User Data Header (UDH) . For example, udh=06050415811581.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.protocol_id
member.summary: The value in decimal format for the higher level protocol to use for this SMS. For example, to send a binary SMS to the SIM Toolkit, this would be protocol-id=127. Ensure that the value of protocol-id is aligned with udh.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.body
member.summary: Hex encoded binary data. For example, body=0011223344556677.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.title
member.summary: The title for a wappush SMS. For example: MyCompanyIsGreat.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.url
member.summary: The URL your user taps to navigate to your website.

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.validity

member.name: P:Nexmo.Api.SMS.SMSRequest.client_ref

For example, the default voice kimberley is a female who speaks English with an American accent (en-US). Possible values for voice_name are listed at https://docs.nexmo.com/voice/voice-api/api-reference#talk_put

member.summary: Set to 0 to replay the audio file at stream_url when the stream ends. The default value is 1.
